articles.title: Lumia 1020 (EOS) image leaked ahead of Thursday's launch
articles.description:
Pictures of the Nokia Lumia 1020 have leaked ahead of its official launch on Thursday.

The Windows Phone 8 device is rumoured to feature a 41-megapixel camera. The 1020 name first emerged on Monday after leaked EXIF data appeared on Flickr.

It has previous been known by a number of codenames, including EOS, Pureview EOS, Lumia 909 and internal codename Elvis.

The leaked renders show yellow, white and black versions of the phone.

According to information leaked to Windows Phone Central, the handset will also ship with built-in optical image stablisation, 2GB of RAM and 32GB of internal storage. It also claimed it will have an F2.2 lens. Interestingly, that is the same as the EXIF data that appeared on Monday.

Other information reported by Windows Phone Central include that the phone will feature both a Xenon and an LED flash, with optical image stabilisation (like the Lumia 920) for excellent low-light shots. Ultrasampling technology makes a comeback from the Pureview 808 when shooting at a resolution of 5 megapixels. Every 7 pixels will be combined into one mega-pixel for superb detail and lossless digital zoom (brush up on that technology by reading our Pureview 808 review).

We're packing our bags for Nokia's Thursday event. We'll bring you more details then!
articles.summary: Pictures of the Nokia Lumia 1020 have leaked ahead of its official launch on Thursday.
articles.author: Simon Khoury

articles.title: Grand Theft Auto 5 gameplay video released
articles.description:
The first Grand Theft Auto 5 gameplay footage has been shown off in a new video released by Rockstar Games.

Is there any game that players are looking forward to more than Grand Theft Auto 5? The latest installment in Rockstar Games's highly rated open-world urban crime series is easily the most anticipated game of 2012 and arguably the best reason to hang onto your current gen console.

While T3 has been one of the fortunate few publications to be allowed to have a preview of GTA5's sprawling delights, information has been rather thin on the ground about what to expect from the game.

We know there are three protagonists, we know that heists are a new big gameplay feature and we know that this is Rockstar's biggest game to date - set, as it is, in an approximation of the city of Los Angeles and the surrounding countryside. But how does it all fit together?

Well, hopefully, the above video, recently released by Rockstar, will answer a few questions punters may have. It details not only the size of the game's massive world, but also the activities they can engage in. There's another brief look at the three main protagonists and a slightly more expanded look at the new system detailing heists. Grand Theft Auto 5's online mode is even teased at the end of the clip.

GTA 5 is scheduled for release on September 17th for PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360.
articles.summary: The first Grand Theft Auto 5 gameplay footage has been shown off in a new video released by Rockstar Games.
articles.author: Nick Cowen

articles.title: Squitto! A 360-degree ball camera you can literally throw away
articles.description:
A panoramic throwable camera with search and rescue qualities, the Squito has a 360-degree view that can be used for search and rescue missions or just for fun.

Ever wanted a camera that you can throw around and not have it crushed into pieces? Squito has come to the rescue! Its inventor, Steve Hollinger, has created a prototype and acquired a patent for a throwable camera that serves as a refreshing update to the one he came up with a few years ago.

Before, the throwable panoramic camera did not have a detailed usage description, but now we can enjoy its features which include being used in the dark, fog, smoke, or at night. It has video stabilization built-in (which means you still get usable video even if the ball is rotating like crazy). It can even be used in a fire rescue, and it has wireless infrared with collaborative stitching properties (gathering and stitching together images from several Squitos) as well. So it's not just for some vanity "look at me shot from above" kind of footage. It can save lives too.

Its design is more appealing than its predecessor, not to mention the variety of capabilities the test unit demonstrates. Any gadget that can be used to watch an infrared video or be used in a fire rescue is sure to be enough to grab the eye of any gadget connoisseur.
articles.summary: A panoramic throwable camera with search and rescue qualities, the Squito has a 360-degree view that can be used for search and rescue missions or just for fun.
articles.author: micha

articles.title: Unique Muslim search engine Halalgoogling launched
articles.description:
Halal's the way ahead for Web Search. Apparently.

"Our Mission is to satisfy the internet needs of the Muslim community, so each Muslim can surf the web in the Halal way." So starts the intro for the Halalgoogling project.  Halalgoogling is rather unique in that it is the world’s first unique Muslim search engine with a built-in system to filter “Haram content”, content which is deemed not to respect Muslim culture. Meaning aspects like gambling can take a walk.

We did try a few uummm... inappropriate searches, which came up red flagged.

The site seems to be in Beta, especially the maps side, as it had very restricted destination options. Interesting idea, especially for parents. What is filtered, what represents right and wrong,  that we would need to find out.
articles.summary: Halal's the way ahead for Web Search. Apparently.
articles.author: Anil George

articles.title: Best Apple iPhone 5 cases and covers 2013
articles.description:
T3 picks the best looking (or most practical) iPhone 5 cases and covers available in 2013 to keep your precious fruit phone snug as a bug in a rug. Got a Galaxy S4? We got you "covered" as well (geddit?)

Proporta iPhone 5 Leather case

Flipping open like the business phones of old, this is a serious-looking case for suited folk. Constructed partly from aluminium to absorb knocks and drops, there's a soft black and cream pinstripe lining and also comes with a free screen protector.

Cygnett UrbanShield

If Apple’s most beautiful product bar none is simply not beautiful enough, you may want to invest in this sleek case offering from Australian case-maker Cygnett. Available in a choice of brushed aluminium and carbon fiber, the slimline shell will add a sleek, but understated look to the new iPhone with access to the camera to shoot freely from its snug surroundings.

Belkin View Case

Perfect for those who want to flaunt their shiny new iPhone 5 in the faces of Android lovers, the View Case sports a transparent polycarbonate back and features a protective band around the edges that is made from a scratch-protecting TPU material.  

Otterbox Defender Series

Tough case experts Otterbox is bringing its three-pronged protection to the iPhone 5 offering durable multi-layered polycarbonate and silicone materials that covers screen, back and sides and will guard not only against bumps and bruises but also against your mucky mitts.

Belkin ProFit Armband

Whether MiCoach, Nike+ or Endomondo is your running app of choice, if you’re investing in the iPhone 5, you are going to need to accommodate that extra screen estate. With an adjustable closure to prevent constant fiddling, there’s also a small pocket to keep your key or enough loose change for a bottle of Lucozade.

Dicota Slim Cover

If you want to maintain the iPhone 5’s slender form but stay protected from house keys and loose change in your pocket, the slim cover will add just 0.88mm in thickness and also help prevent daily damage to your Apple smartphone. You can take your pick from blue, black, white or transparent shades of the slimline case.

CalypsoCase Rainbow

If you are willing to spend a bit more on a more luxurious mobile home for the iPhone 5, CalypsoCase has joined forces with designer Lara Bohnic to bring her unique style to its latest handcrafted cases which include the ‘Rainbow’ made from a fashionista-loving glossy leather with silver finishing.

LifeProof Frē

LifeProof claims that the Frē case is the most advanced ever built. It offers incredibly comprehensive, military grade elemental protection for your iPhone 5, along with good looks and a few colour choices. Not only that, the Lifeproof case protects your camera lense with CrystalClear glass, ensuring that your photos remain, well... crystal clear.

Incipio ATLAS

The ATLAS - due for release in February 2013 - is waterproof, dustproof, snowproof, drop-proof, shockproof and, probably lots of other things... proof. It's waterproof to a depth of 2m, for around an hour, making it not quite as waterproof as the LifeProof case, or the Seidio OBEX. But what it lacks on that front, it makes up for with striking design.

HitcasePRO

Hitcase has been around for a while if you're an iPhone 4/4S user, but at CES the hardcase manufacturers confirmed that the Hitcase would be available for iPhone 5 on March 1st. The Hitcase covers the entirety of your iPhone, protecting it from all manner of dangerous situations, as well as being waterproof to 10 metres. It even comes with a harness for GoPro-esque shenanigans.

Scosche kickBACK Sport

An integrated kickstand makes FaceTime calling and movie watching a doddle, whilst the shock-resistant polycarbonate exterior offers protection during active workouts. A sweat, dirt, oil and abrasion-resistant material ensures this is the ideal case for those with an active lifestyle.

Snugg case

There is nothing worse than pulling out your shiny, new iPhone and noticing a scratch on that beautiful glass rear or a dirty rub mark on the aluminium antenna. The Snugg Skinny fit iPhone provides a rubberised silicone designed to ‘hug’ your iPhone giving it comforting protection without sacrificing any of the slim design.

Incipio Feather

A barely-noticeable, 1mm thin, ultra strong polymer case for those who want protection from house keys and loose change. Slightly larger (0.12mm) than the Dicota Slim Cover, but the opaque charcoal grey colour way retains the sleek design as Apple intended it.

Griffin Explorer

With a shatter-resistant polycarbonate frame surrounded in a rugged, shock-absorbing silicone, Griffin’s Survivor collection protects from more than just the daily commute: dirt, sand, rain, shock and vibration are all left in the wake of apocalypse-enduring protector. And it's available in a whopping 294 colour combos.

Gear4 Wave

A simple clip-on case from Gear4 provides access to all the necessary external buttons and new Lightning charge port. Most importantly, the cover itself looks great with a grooved wave design.

Case-Mate Creatures

Available in Monkey, Peacock, Penguin and Panda flavours, these fun, colourful cases feature easy-to-hold grips to ensure that no iPhone's were harmed during the making of this case. Features a raised bezel that adds extra screen protection

X-Doria Dash

The only iPhone case with a window. The X-Doria Dash combines a glossy polycarbonate with a unique, perforated fabric that looks visually striking but provides all the necessary protection for your new iPhone.

Seidio OBEX

The OBEX is designed to make sure you're pride and joy never gets so much as a scratch of damage, however badly you treat it. Rubber Silicone stoppers keep dust and liquids out of the key ports, whilst waterproof membranes protect the speakers and microphones without hurting the quality of your calls.

Incase x Mara Hoffman Snap case

The iPhone 5 is a beautiful device, but it does lack a bit of colour. Brighten up your prized possession with this Incase snap case, with added artwork from uber trendy New York designer, Mara Hoffman.

Griffin Beamhaus Pocket

Encase your iPhone in this suede lined, leather clad beauty. You know it deserves it. Along with being stylish, the Beamhaus Pocket is also practical, with a nifty slot for cards or spare cash and even comes in its own carrying pouch.

Belkin Lego Builder case

Release your inner child and add a tad of creativity to your iPhone 5, while protecting it from unwanted bumps. Shock absorbent and scratch resistance features aside, this case from Belkin also lets you add classic Lego bricks right on its back.

Proporta Ted Baker cases

This is a nice slim case that will protect from light bumps and scrapes - but Ted Baker is the star of the show here. The Autumn/Winter collection uses natty floral regalia, for those who are more than comfortable with their sexuality.

iFoolish 2 case

There are plenty of polycarbonate protective cases out there, but there's only one that has an 4-inch drawing board on the back. There's also a pen that fits nicely into the case, so you can amuse yourself on the tube, or leave messages for your friends.

Tavik Pentry

Form-fitting Plexitonium hugs the curves of your precious iPhone, protecting it from bumps and scrapes - as per your usual silicone case. This one also comes with a full alphabet's worth of letters to insert into the back, so you can spell out a five letter word of your choice.

Case-Mate Madison

Though not the most protective cover we've seen for a phone, the Madison makes up for it with chic styling, thanks to tthe quilted leather casing finished with Swarovski crystal inserts. Also, there is a soft, microfibre lining - so you're not totally helpless if your phone slips from your grasp.

Case-Mate Artistry Wood

These cases start off as a piece of exotic hardwood - sourced in a manner most friendly to the environment of course - before having a thin aluminium bezel added. Simple and elegant. You can chose from a variety of woods, and all have an inlay to help protect your phone from impacts.

2013: Pantone Universe Bookcase

Clearly iPad Bookcase inspired, the Pantone Universe Bookcase folds out and lets you view your iPhone in a portrait or landscape viewing position, as well as dressing your iPhone 5 up in a smart variety of colours.
articles.summary: T3 picks the best looking (or most practical) iPhone 5 cases and covers available in 2013 to keep your precious fruit phone snug as a bug in a rug. Got a Galaxy S4? We got you "covered" as well (geddit?)
articles.author: Simon Khoury

articles.title: EA: Next-gen tablet games to match PS3 and Xbox 360 graphics quality
articles.description:
According to EA Labels president Frank Gibeau in an interview with IGN, the "next wave" of gaming on tablets and mobile devices will be able to take on the same graphics capabilities as the PS3 and Xbox 360.

During the interview Gibeau stated, "Some of our engine technology that used to be console-specific now can, with modifications, be able to power games on tablets and on phones in the near future."

EA have been working on developing DICE's Frostbite games engine to translate to iOS and Android gaming.

Although in development, there are complications in bringing current gen graphic design to mobile and tablet gaming.

Gibeau expresses it's not as easy as just bringing it over, "You have to re-architect it around touch, voice, camera. Our teams are having a lot of fun with that, reimagining an experience on a tablet using the same graphics and assets in some ways, but completely remixing the meal."

Earlier this year EA announced that they would not be producing any new titles for the Nintendo Wii U.

The announcement came just two weeks after DICE exec revealed that Wii U struggles on Frostbite 2, so Frostbite 3 engine games such as Mass Effect 4, Dragon Age III: Inquisition, and Battlefield 4 would not be coming to Wii U.

Source: IGN
articles.summary: According to EA Labels president Frank Gibeau in an interview with IGN, the "next wave" of gaming on tablets and mobile devices will be able to take on the same graphics capabilities as the PS3 and Xbox 360.
articles.author: Grace Dean

articles.title: Apple’s App Store is now holding the top games and apps for free
articles.description:
The dream of being able to download games and apps from the App Store will be coming true in a couple of days.

Upon celebrating its 5-year anniversary this week, Apple’s App Store is discounting your favorite games, like Infinity Blade II and Badland, for free, completely. This is sure to get the company many ‘Happy Anniversary’ wishes.

Mobile devices can continue to give their praises to Apple as well, for bringing about higher-quality applications since July 10.

Since the revolutionary creation of the APP Store, total apps available reached a record of 900,000 with a staggering 50 billion apps downloaded. We will be waiting for the amount of apps available to possibly hit the one million mark soon.  

Even though the full list of games to be available for free has yet to be released, the games should be named in the next two days. Until then, you’re going to have to keep your patience and take a look at the ones that you want.
articles.summary: The dream of being able to download games and apps from the App Store will be coming true in a couple of days.
articles.author: micha

articles.title: Life-logging may be possible on smartphones using the Saga app
articles.description:
The Saga app, known to capture each move you make, will soon be available on smartphones to simplify the process of life-logging.

Currently, engineers from the company that has brought about this app, ARO, is creating the technology to make it possible to use a barometer, microphones, cameras and even the location sensors on the phone, to know where someone is and what they’re doing.

The new approach to the app is said to be available in the early fall or late summer. The good news about running the app on your phone is that it does not take up too much of the phone’s battery. It is only expected to take up around 1% of the mobile’s battery while conducting the background activities.

A person’s motion is itself a trigger for the app in the instance where their device’s accelerometer claims that the person is not in stand-still. Checking someone’s location is therefore activated when they’re in motion.

You can presently find the app available free of charge on iOS and Android so you can get close perceptions of your daily activities. In addition to tracking your acts on a daily basis, you can get data from other social networking databases like FitBit.

At the moment, tests are being conducted to internally test the application so it can be adapted on Android devices as well. This is being done through testing a device’s microphone so a person’s acts are made known.

As chief components of sound and light are being sampled, Saga could officially be capable of keeping record of your life automatically.
articles.summary: The Saga app, known to capture each move you make, will soon be available on smartphones to simplify the process of life-logging.
articles.author: micha

articles.title: Instagram adds the landscape mode for photos and gives iOS the cinema mode
articles.description:
Adding a landscape orientation to Instagram photos is finally an option.

If you’re an iPhone-owner, you’re probably among the countless Apple customers who have complained at least one point or another about not being able to apply a landscape mode on Instagram, but now, the wait for your pleas to be answered is over.

Known for its versatile settings to help make memories, Instagram has finally added a landscape mode to its photo settings. The app already allows taking photos and videos with added filter features, which include being able to give a photo a dated look.

Until now, with the added landscape orientation, the online photo and video sharing app is only available on iOS. Instagram could always grab photos with a square shape with an added rotation function, but if you decide to turn an Apple device sideways, now, the photo menu can be oriented accordingly.

Find Instagram’s 4.0.2 update in Apple’s App Store today.

In addition to the landscape mode, Instagram has added an update for front-facing cameras used for video shots: cinema mode. The cinema feature is reserved exclusively for Apple’s products: the iPhone, iPod Touch, and iPad.

So, for those using Android, you’re going to have to wait a bit longer to have the new added Instagram capabilities.
articles.summary: Adding a landscape orientation to Instagram photos is finally an option.
articles.author: micha

articles.title: Is it the Moto X or Droid Maxx? Twitter has the answer
articles.description:
What appeared to have been a sneak-peak leak of the Moto X, in fact turned out to be the new member of the Droid family.

Wondering what’s new from the infamous EVLeaks (Twitter leaker)? Apparently the well-informedtweeter posted a leaked press photo this weekend showing what you may suspect to be the new Motorola phone: Moto X.

Don’t be fooled (like we and many others were). If you look closely, you’ll notice that the shot in fact shows the up-and-coming Droid Maxx. As a novel interpretation of Google’s Droid brand, which undergoes several appearances worldwide, the Maxx comes to replace the Droid Razor Maxx, introduced last year.

Good news for carbon-fiber loyalists, the new version of the Razor Maxx still seems to hold a carbon fiber cover. Since it’s a tad challenging to spot the actual phone dimensions from the leaked picture, we can only assume that the phone’s bezel is slimmer than its earlier forms.

Ever since the company came out with its first QWERTY-based Android handsets, the Droid line has become very popular. Currently, it is even more prevalent among Motorola fans who have disregarded the slight decrease in Droid’s heat recently.

Besides the leaked shot of the new phone from EVLeaks, really nothing else has been revealed to discern additional enhancements or changes.

However, seeing as how Motorola has made a great shift into Google, launching further additions like a Droid handset to the line would serve as an advantage to fulfil customer curiosity.

Despite certain assumptions that Google may not continue collaborating with Motorola on new devices, for now launchings are still on the table. So, it’s worth looking into any future probable releases.
articles.summary: What appeared to have been a sneak-peak leak of the Moto X, in fact turned out to be the new member of the Droid family.
articles.author: micha

articles.title: The budget iPhone is here!
articles.description:
Or is it? Leaked images show what could be the final form of the budget iPhone, in 5 color variants, including a rather garish green

When it comes to a low cost iPhone, the ‘If’s have been replaced by ‘When?’s. We’d reported earlier on how Apple had scaled up production in anticipation for the low cost budget phone. And apparently, this will be coming to town by the September-October timeframe seen during the past two years, along with the iPhone 5S. 

Techdy reports that it has gotten its hands on what it believes to be legitimate front and rear parts for this lower-cost plastic iPhone, offering the first good look at how the device will appear fully assembled. Among the most obvious differences from previous assumptions is the use of a black panel for the device as opposed to white. Techdy tells us that this black front panel will be used with all color variations of the rear shell, which will reportedly include blue, pink, yellow, green, and white. The color variations, let’s be honest, do sound more economy than business.

“The budget iPhone will be made substantially from plastic (we can feel it’s actually polycarbonate material). It will have a 4” screen, like the iPhone 5, and interestingly, the budget iPhone actually has a shape that’s similar to Apple’s original iPod. When we hold the budget iPhone in our hands, the plastic chassis does not feel cheap at all. Unlike the plastic build quality of the Samsung Galaxy phones, the plastic material used on the budget iPhone feels more sturdy.” are the words of wisdom from the site. Techdy has even created a $199 Android-powered clone of the device called the Basic Bear, running on Android 4.2 Jelly Bean, 16GB storage, 4-inch display and 1.7GHz quad-core snapdragon 600 CPU, which not surprisingly, is scheduled to begin shipping in September.

So now, let’s await that moment, two months away, when the iPhone and iOS shall officially go mass.
articles.summary: Or is it? Leaked images show what could be the final form of the budget iPhone, in 5 color variants, including a rather garish green
articles.author: Anil George

articles.title: Apple iPhone 5S release date, features, specs and rumours
articles.description:
The Apple iPhone 5S release date could be as soon as September 2013, with the phone tipped to feature a fingerprint scanner, NFC, Full HD and different colours.

When it comes to smartphones, the first few months of 2013 moved the proverbial goalposts. Android handsets flourished with Full HD screens, aluminium or glass unibodies and every feature under the sun.

Apple’s iPhone 5 has been on the scene for a while now but its thunder is in danger of being stolen by the Android Army.

The question we all want to know is what will Apple do next? With Cupertino updating the iPad 3 just months after releasing it, there are reports that an iPad Mini 2 or even an Apple TV could be on the way.

What we know for sure though, is that the company will want to reclaim its smartphone crown. So, T3 has gathered together everything we know about the rumoured iPhone 5S.

Apple iPhone 5S casing

A range of leaked images have poured onto the net showing brightly coloured devices reported to be the so-called iPhone Light. French website NoWhereElse posted the images that share similar physical traits to the iPod Nano.

Its exterior is said to be plastic polycarbonate and much more economical to build suggesting that Apple are aiming at a younger target market or at least consumers with less disposable income.

The devices come in blue, green, yellow, red and white yet Apple unsurprisingly has remained quiet on the subject with nothing being confirmed. Leaked schematics and blueprints also report that the Light is a bit thicker and wider than the iPhone 5.

With two types of chasis being leaked one could come to the conclusion that Apple might retain the same metal design for the iPhone 6 whilst the iPhone 5S will now come sporting this cheaper plastic body

Up until now, Apple hasn’t strayed from the white/black colour scheme for its phones but Topeka Capital Research analyst Brian White has said he believes that along with different colours, the iPhone 5S may arrive in different sizes.

This appears to be backed up by Japanese tech site Macotakara which also believes the iPhone 5S will have three extra colours added to the black or white standard.

If Apple launched three models, for example with 3.5-inch, 4-inch and 5-inch screens, it would allow the company to grab both premium and budget customers.

However, this could be more of a plan for the iPhone 6 with Apple surely looking to compete with the larger handsets out there like the Galaxy Note 2 and the Xperia Z Ultra. At the bare minimum, we’d expect to see a better camera (although don’t expect ultrapixels, HTC One-style) and a faster processor.

Apple iPhone 5S specs

When it comes to the specs of the next iPhone, at the very least we expect Apple to use the A6X chip currently found in the latest iPad. However, the latest rumours suggest Apple could be working on an A7 chip for the forthcoming iPad 5.

In years gone by, Apple has previously worked with Samsung to produce processors for it's iPhone range. But, given the recent legal tussels between the two companies, many speculate that Apple will want to distance itself from the Korean company. Some rumours have hinted at an Intel chip being included in the next iteration of the iPhone.

Some purported images of iPhone 5S prototypes appear to show a change in the hardware configuration that suggests Apple is moving things around to make space for a bigger battery or extra features such as NFC.

Apple famously decided to withhold NFC for the iPhone 5 and since both the Samsung Galaxy S3 and Samsung Galaxy S4 have arrived toting the new connectivity, Apple may want to incorporate it this time around.

Recent reports from Taiwan and tech website NFC World indicate that manufacturer Chipbond has won a major contract to build components for the iPhone 5S - including NFC. What's more, other rumours suggest that Apple will go further and include a fingerprint scanner in the iPhone 5S, adding in extra security.

In terms of storage, there is the strong possibility of Apple launching a new phone with 128GB storage – similar to the latest iPad upgrade.

Meanwhile Jeffries analyst Peter Misek told Business Insider that he believes the iPhone 5S will feature a “Super HD screen” along with a range of colours similar to the iPod Touch range. Considering all the top Android handsets feature Full HD displays, we reckon its unlikely Apple will launch the iPhone 5S with anything less than a 1,920 x 1,080 pixel resolution.

Apple iPhone 5S camera

It’s well known that one of the key battlegrounds of smartphone warfare is the specifications of the on-board camera. The Sony Xperia Z and Galaxy S4 arrived sporting 13MP cameras while HTC upset the apple cart by including a 4MP “ultrapixel” camera into its HTC One handset.

Apple has consistently upped the camera specs in each of its models and its no stretch to think that the company will do the same for the iPhone 5S. According to iLounge, Cupertino isn’t planning to go down the HTC route and will instead launch the 5S with a 13MP camera – putting it in league with the Sony and Samsung handsets.

Of course, hardware is only half the story and if Apple can come up with some killer in-house apps to take advantage of the camera in new ways it will give them a good start on the competition.

Apple iPhone 5S pictures

A few interesting pictures have leaked out onto the web regarding the iPhone 5S. One of the first to emerge was the back of an unspecified type of iPhone that was leaked to Nowhereelse.fr.

There’s not much to go on here, but – as expected – the casing and design looks almost identical to the iPhone 5. Tellingly though, the serial numbers underneath the iPhone moniker aren’t listed.

While it would certainly fit with the design of the current iPhone it doesn't yet confirm whether the 5S will come in a range of colours - much like it did with the iPod Touch - or whether the company will simply stick to the black/white variants.

This second image (pictured at the start of this article) apparently shows stripped-down iPhone 5S casing next to a current iPhone 5 teardown image. The snap was initially uploaded to iPhone4Parts and looks very similar to Apple’s current design – except with a few screws lost along the way.

Apple iPhone 5S release date

Plenty of sources have weighed in with opinions on when the iPhone 5S and the overriding good news is that it appears to be sooner rather than later. For the most part, the majority of rumours hinged on late summer as the likely date for the new phone.

Business Insider recently came across reports that the new iPhone 5S will be enter production in June 2013. Manufacturers like Sharp, LG and JapanDisplay are said to be constructing displays for the new hanset and the actual device itself may arrive in "the Fall".

This would be in line with Apple's announcement at WWDC 2013 where the company unveiled its new mobile operating system iOS

Still, fingers crossed, eh?
articles.summary: The Apple iPhone 5S release date could be as soon as September 2013, with the phone tipped to feature a fingerprint scanner, NFC, Full HD and different colours.
articles.author: Michael Sawh

articles.title: T3 imagines the Ultimate Smartphone in 3D render [video]
articles.description:
We have created the ultimate smartphone. Ok so not literally but what we have done is taken the best aspects from the best smartphones around today - HTC's One, Samsung's Galaxy S4, Sony's Xperia Z, and Nokia's upcoming EOS Lumia 1020 - and blended them together to create what we think would be the greatest smartphone you could possibly buy.

To make sure it ran as well as it looked we took two brand-new quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 800 chips and combined them with a ludicrous 16GB RAM and 128GB of storage (ok so we got a bit carried away with that one).

A sleek aluminium body comes courtesy of the iPhone 5 and the HTC One both of which boast stunning aluminiun designs which not only look good but make them sturdier.

BoomSound stereo speakers come courtesy of the HTC One whilst on the back there's the 41MP PureView camera which Nokia showcased on the 808 PureView.

We haven't stopped there though, thanks to some inspiration from the Sony Xperia Z Ultra we've made it IP57 water-resistant and dustproof whilst the icing on the cake?

Turn the phone on its side and a laser keyboard will project down onto any surface removing the need to use those pesky small keyboards. Oh and if you can't decide between iOS 7 and Android 4.2, you won't have to as this will dual-boot.

This wasn't all us though, T3 asked YouTube viewers what they'd like to see on the ultimate smartphone and using those ideas we were able to create this.

So now we're asking you, our readers, did we miss anything out? Like the design? Hate it? If you could change anything what would it be? Start the deabte on our official T3 Facebook page or on Twitter.
articles.summary: We have created the ultimate smartphone. Ok so not literally but what we have done is taken the best aspects from the best smartphones around today - HTC's One, Samsung's Galaxy S4, Sony's Xperia Z, and Nokia's upcoming EOS Lumia 1020 - and blended them together to create what we think would be the greatest smartphone you could possibly buy.
articles.author: T3 Middle East

articles.title: Google to reveal the Motorola Moto X on 11th of July
articles.description:
The Motorola Moto X will not only be Google's first true 'Google phone' but it'll also be the first major smartphone since the search engine bought the smartphone company.

Motorola has unveiled its first advert for the Motorola Moto X with both the advert and outside sources suggesting that Google's first own-brand smartphone will be getting unveiled next week.

According PhoneArena.com technology broadcaster Leo Laporte has said that he was invited by new Morotola employee Guy Kawasaki to one of their events on July 10th and 11th.

It’s unclear what exactly the event would be about however Kawasaki apparently emphasised that it was an event for selected tech journalists and that it was going to be something quite important.

This is after Motorola recently released their promotional ad featuring two people diving off a wooden dock, which according to an observant tech-reader might be representing the roman numerals XI meaning 11. At this point this is merely analytical speculation however the coincidental press event does highlight suspicion. 

It is also possible that the event will reveal more details on the Motorola Droid RAZR Ultra devices that have been long in the pipeline however its likely that if rumours are true, the day will solely focus on the Moto X.

Despite previously reported leaks, the Moto X will not feature top of the line hardware but will got head-to-head with other mid market devices. It will have a Qualcomm MSM8960 Pro dual-core processor marked at 1.7GHz.

As far as software goes it will be running on Android 4.2.2 Jelly Bean, the latest version of the operating system.  

Leaked specifications have also suggested a 720p display with no word of screen size. The Moto X will pack a 10 megapixel camera on back along with a 2 megapixel on the front – reasonably stacking it against other current mid-range devices. 

The phone is also said to carry 2GB of Ram and 16GB of internal storage.

Motorola CEO Dennis Woodside discussed the Moto X at an AllThingsD event in May, saying it would be made in an old Nokia factory outside Fort Worth, Texas, and will be very sensor-based.

“The new phone will know when you take it out of your pocket, for example,” said Woodside. “It anticipates my needs.”

Source: Phonearena
articles.summary: The Motorola Moto X will not only be Google's first true 'Google phone' but it'll also be the first major smartphone since the search engine bought the smartphone company.
articles.author: T3 Middle East

articles.title: Halo 4 best selling game published by Microsoft Studios
articles.description:
Microsoft has revealed that Halo 4 is the best selling game ever published by Microsoft Studios in the US.

The company announced that 343 Industries’ first foray into the Halo franchise has topped Halo 3 “for sales during each respective launch year”.

That means that the title has so far sold more than Halo 3 during its first 12 months, but it has not topped overall sales yet.

Bungie retired from the Halo series it created following the release of Halo 3: OSDT.

Major Nelson also announced that The Halo 4 Global Championship is planned for later this summer.

According to the Microsoft exec, it will be competed in across a mix of live and online events.

A total of $500,000 in prizes will be available, with the winner walking away with $200,000 alone.

The event kicks off this weekend at Rooster Teeth Expo in Austin, Texas. Play offs will begin on Xbox Live from July 15th.

Via: MCV
articles.summary: Microsoft has revealed that Halo 4 is the best selling game ever published by Microsoft Studios in the US.
articles.author: Ben Furfie

articles.title: The International HTC One gets the Android 4.2.2 Jelly Bean
articles.description:
Most of you who own the international version of the HTC One do not have to wait that long for the arrival of the Android 4.2.2 Jelly Bean.

With the new arrival of the 4.2.2 Jelly Bean, you can now enjoy a considerable amount of updates ranging from a better Launcher bar to enhanced home button performance.

HTC’s One is a relevant success which is foreseen to be additionally successful through the Android 4.2.2 update.

In addition to the mentioned enhancements, new features include a novel lock screen arrangement, rearrangements to the widget, along with the choice of showing the level of the phone’s battery along the status bar. Not to mention its automatic qualities like auto-focus lock and auto-exposure found on the camera viewfinder.

The international unit in Taiwan was found to already have the update, according to AndroidCentral. This is a precursor of what to expect for other international models as well. The United States, however, may not be among the first to inhabit the advancement seeing as how its regulations still require that the update go through carrier testing. So what does this mean for companies like AT&T, T-Mobile, and Sprint? They will just have to wait a bit longer.

AndroidCentral is suspecting the launch of the HTC One with the Android 4.2.2 for Verizon. Although, there is still not enough verification at the present time to confirm the speculation.
articles.summary: Most of you who own the international version of the HTC One do not have to wait that long for the arrival of the Android 4.2.2 Jelly Bean.
articles.author: micha

articles.title: 5 of the best Google Reader replacements: Your RSS fix here
articles.description:
Did the retirement of Google Reader leave you in a state of RSS blues? Or even worse, unable to keep up with the interwebs? Fear not, T3 trawled the web for the best 5 RSS reader alternatives.

Gallery below at your disposal.

1. Feedly

Possibly the service most tipped to take over from Google Reader, Feedly has already benefited from its demise, bringing in a host of new features and users to boot. It’s the simple approach that makes it highly recommendable; just log in with your old Google Reader account and all your feeds will return, shown in a modern, slick and picture centric view. Feedly also has companion apps for both iOS and Android so wherever you are you’ll be up-to-date.

Link: Feedly

2. Digg Reader

Digg reader, while not as feature rich as Feedly, is much more visually simple. Its two column view is bare, yet shows all your updates in an easy to read manner. It has efficient keyboard shortcuts for power users and a nifty popular tab to see what other people are reading. If you’re a big fan of Instapaper, Digg could be the reader for you as both are operated by Betaworks so the integration is seamless.

Link: Digg Reader

3. AOL Reader

While still in Beta, AOL Reader is purpose built as a Google Reader replacement. Again, it offers migration from your old accounts and a plethora of sharing options. Its interface is straightforward, with a list of feeds on the left and a picture based view of all your news to the right. As with the other readers, it’s simple and all about delivering and discovering content. Unfortunately app support is lacking and AOL says they have iOS and Android apps on the way, but for now the website displays well enough on mobile devices.

Link: AOL Reader

4. NewsBlur

If you want more features for your buck then NewsBlur could be for you. It focuses on delivering content quickly, updating your feeds every minute so you’re never out of the loop. You can view stories on their original site as well as sharing them with others. While it is free for up to 64 feeds, if you’re a power user it’s going to set you back $24 a year for more. It's not be pretty, but its power features are a definite plus.

Link: NewsBlur
Price: $24 a year (for more than 64 feeds)

5. Pulse

Pulse has been around for a while as a mobile app, but now they’re making a push for the online space. Big pictures are the name of the game, and Pulse puts striking images front and centre. The set up is easy too, enabling you to quickly populate your feeds with news topics such as sport or technology. Google Reader importing is also supported to make a pretty complete package, but probably one for the casual user.

Link: Pulse
articles.summary: Did the retirement of Google Reader leave you in a state of RSS blues? Or even worse, unable to keep up with the interwebs? Fear not, T3 trawled the web for the best 5 RSS reader alternatives.
articles.author: Simon Khoury

articles.title: Gears of War producer quits to work on Mass Effect 4
articles.description:
With work on the Xbox One and PS4 title already underway Epic Games’ Chris Wynn announced via Twitter that he will be joining BioWare to focus on the Mass Effect 4.

After working as lead producer on Gears of War 3 and Senior Producer on Gears of War: Judgment, Chris Wynn is set to exit Epic Games and join BioWare as Senior Development Director on the next installment in the Mass Effect series. 

Wynn tweeted "Thrilled to announce that I will be joining BioWare as the Sr. Development Director on the next Mass Effect!”   

His exit follows the recent trend of senior staff members that have departed Epic, including designer Cliff Bleszinki and producer Rod Fergusson.

Little is known about the sequel to the critically acclaimed Mass Effect 3 with details being kept under wraps however we do know that it will use the Frostbite 3 engine, much like Dragon Age: Inquisition.

According to a report by IGN Frostbite is capable of providing the “Highest standard of immersion in entertainment” by utilizing an “Unmatched level of visual and audio fidelity”. The game engine also has the ability to improve character animations as well as dynamic environments 

BioWare Montreal executive producer Casey Hudson revealed in March that work has begun on the third-person shooter and that it will not be a direct sequel to the 2012 hit. 

He said: “We are starting to get ready to develop another Mass Effect game, and it's going to be a new thing. We want to be able to give fans an opportunity to get back into the world with these things you've come to know and love about the Mass Effect experience, but start something fresh and new; a new way for you to explore the whole universe in Mass Effect”

The release date of Mass Effect 4 has not yet been announced by Electronic Arts.
articles.summary: With work on the Xbox One and PS4 title already underway Epic Games’ Chris Wynn announced via Twitter that he will be joining BioWare to focus on the Mass Effect 4.
articles.author: T3 Middle East

articles.title: Samsung postpones its first Tizen smartphone
articles.description:
The much-awaited release of the first Tizen smartphone from Samsung has been delayed.

The launch of the Tizen OS, supported by Samsung and Intel, has been postponed for about two months after it was supposed to debut by Samsung sometime in August.

The delay is mainly due to some concerns Samsung was having with the OS, particularly with the App Store itself. According to both designers of the app outlet, Intel and Samsung, the Store is not yet ready to head out into the market since there is a still a need for tweaking along with adding additional applications. Regardless, many are still unconvinced about the launch of Tizen.

This OS is not the first try by Samsung to develop its own operating system. Its first try was with Bada, which although was not that successful, didn’t do so bad. However, Samsung’s Wave handsets will have a positive effect since after all, by the end of 2011, they brought a $10 million revenue to the company. This means that the Tizen will have a better chance to show-up the Bada by a significantly large margin.

However, regardless of its flexibility, the Tizen will still face some challenges in the market. This is especially the case in terms of competition, seeing as how the Tizen is among other up-and-coming mobile operating systems. The most notable competitors today include the just recently launched Firefox OS and the popular Ubuntu Mobile.

So be sure to stay posted on how these three systems will manage among one another in the OS world.
articles.summary: The much-awaited release of the first Tizen smartphone from Samsung has been delayed.
articles.author: micha

articles.title: New app lets you easily reserve and pay for parking in Dubai
articles.description:
No more fumbling for your car registration number, zone number, and drafting tangled SMS messages. Developer GadgetCheck is hoping his mPark app will simplify parking, namely in Dubai...

Having a tough time finding parking in any city is a commonplace problem so why not use an app that minimizes that hassle? This may not be an option yet for your region, but it may well be soon.

mPark is an SMS-based parking system that allows you to reserve a spot and pay for it via a text message, and is employed in several major cities around the world. But looking for your car registration number and your spot zone while being late for a meeting isn't something you would want to do.

Now meet the mPark app by GadgetCheck. It only works for Dubai denizens at the moment, but it simplifies the process of finding and reserving parking berth for your vehicle.

The app memorizes your car's tag number (several cars can be saved in advance). You then pick your parking zone, and choose a parking spot plus the amount of time you prefer to have it saved for. The app crafts the tedious SMS message for you, and you're done. Go ace that interview!

You can get the aptly named mPark app fron Android's Play Store. The developer says he might add more cities soon, so make sure to follow the active development thread over at XDA-Developers.
articles.summary: No more fumbling for your car registration number, zone number, and drafting tangled SMS messages. Developer GadgetCheck is hoping his mPark app will simplify parking, namely in Dubai...
articles.author: T3 Middle East

articles.title: Canon releases the EOS 70D camera, replaces the 60D
articles.description:
Ready to hit the shelves at the end of August, camera-connoisseur Canon has unveiled its newest addition to the EOS series – the EOS 70D.

Canon has proved the rumours right by revealing the latest entry in its popular EOS series, the mid-level EOS 70D.

Boasted to be the “first Digital SLR in the world to feature Dual Pixel CMOS AF technology” – which in layman’s terms essentially means it delivers a smooth and accurate auto focus when shooting full HD movies and rapid acquisition when shooting in Live View mode.

Technically it’s said to be a ‘huge step-up from the 60D’, with the ability to capture full resolution images at up to 7 frames per second with up to 65 JPEG or 16 RAW images in one single burst.  

Canon Ambassador Brutus Östling said: “The EOS 70D is the perfect camera for anyone that wants to develop their photography skills. Not only is it suited to shooting people, landscapes and action easily and in outstanding quality, but also filming subjects in Full HD with focus speeds I never thought would be possible”.  

This new benchmark is paired with the 14-bit DIGIC 5+ processor and 19-point all cross-type system with a native ISO range of ISO 100-12800.

Basically allowing the photographer to shoot in lower light conditions and use fast shutter speeds whilst still retaining the same high image quality – undoubtedly a useful asset.

It packs an impressive 20.2MP sensor combined with a new intelligent viewfinder that will track subjects as they move to automatically align the framing proportionately. Much like its predecessor, the EOS 60D, Wi-FI connectivity is built in to allow users to remotely control the camera via a Smartphone or tablet.

The 70D alone will cost $1,199 but will also be released as part of a kit with an additional 18-55mm STM lens, priced at $1349. Another package also includes an 18-135mm STM lens costing $1549.

Until its release nearer the end of August, Canon expects the EOS 60D to remain on sale for the meantime.
articles.summary: Ready to hit the shelves at the end of August, camera-connoisseur Canon has unveiled its newest addition to the EOS series – the EOS 70D.
articles.author: T3 Middle East

articles.title: Metro: Last Light, exclusive interview
articles.description:
It’s the game that’s got gaming wags shakin’ and droolin’. Metro: Last Light takes off from where Metro 2033 left off, going beak, make that bleaker, with Communists, stranded subways and the odd Nazi. T3 Middle East spoke to Huw Beynon, Global Brand Manager for Metro Last Light on the development roadmap and The Art Of Apocalyptic Survival Horror Color Texturing.

Interview: Anil George, Support: Viva Entertainment

a.

What do you think differentiates Metro: Last Light from Metro 2033, and from the larger first-person shooter category games? The amazing graphics machine and far improved physics have been noted by many gamers.

Well, there are two questions here!

Firstly, we feel the Metro series is significantly removed from the vast majority of ‘shooters’ – and this is because our focus has always been on creating a rich, believable world, and providing the player with a deep, meaningful story as a way to explore that world.

We don’t really class Metro as a ‘shooter’ – yes, it has combat elements, but as you have seen, there are large section of the game where you experience very different styles of gameplay, whether that be pure survival, horror, or exploration.

So Metro is first and foremost a ‘1st person story’ that combines gameplay genres and styles that help tell that story.

To the other part of your question – what differentiates Last Light from 2033 – this is a more subtle distinction, as we feel we got the basic  formula right with Metro 2033. We didn’t want to change it fundamentally.

Instead, we focused a lot on refining key ,mechanics – stealth, combat; improving our technology and visual fidelity; exploring a different set of narrative themes; and experimenting with a richer, more colourful palette and art style.

b.

Visually, how did you go about ensuring the sheer bleakness of the environment around the player. While Metro 2033 fell in a relatively straight forward post apocalyptic survival horror category , Last Light seems to be following a more fantasy horror theme….

It’s amazing what a bit of colour can do J. Although we think the Russian setting, and the unique environment of the Metro helped us stand out from that ‘generic’ post-apocalyptic setting, we wanted to try something new for Last Light. I think Metro 2033 mostly avoided the ‘grey brown’ trap that is leveled at a lot of shooters / post-apocalyptic games due to our use of lighting, which gave us a lot of colour themes to add to the underground areas. However, the surface remained this uniformly bleak, desolate, ice-locked landscape full of blues, whites and greys. For Metro: Last Light we knew we didn’t want to just re-tread these environments – as artists, this is actually pretty boring. So we did a few things to change the look of the game, without losing that bleakness. Most important was moving the time frame of the story on a year – in this time, the nuclear winter has begun to thaw, and the first signs of spring are here. Our outdoor environments now have running water, the first signs of vegetation, sunlight breaking through the clouds. We also added day / night cycles and dramatic weather effects – thunder storms, rolling fog and cloud, howling winds blowing debris into your vision – these changes combined to give us a much richer and varied palette when building our outdoor environments, without losing that ‘bleakness’ that defines Metro.

For our interiors, we use many more light sources, and more varied lights – from harsh white strip lights, to soft blue paraffin lamps, to the green glow of luminous fungus – all interplaying to create richer environments. And lastly, we thought a lot about location design – particularly our Station Cities. In D6, Venice and the Bolshoi Theater we created three very distinct environments, from each other and from any of the Stations of Metro 2033.

c.

When the game was originally shown at the 2011 E3 show, it was included in the Wii U show-reel, what were the issues faced in releasing the game on the Wii platform.

It came down to time / resource – or rather a lack of the two. We are a small studio, and we are already trying to release the game on a new platform (PS3 – Metro 2033 was 360 and PC only).When it came to the crunch, we felt that dedicating staff to a Wii U version at the expense  of PC, 360 and PS3 would be to the detriment of the overall quality of the product.

We certainly didn’t mean to mislead anyone at E3 2011 – at that time we were a long way from launch, and it all seemed possible. There is certainly no technical reason why we could not get Metro to run on the platform, given some time and focus to take advantage of the hardware.

d.

A PlayStation 4 version of the game has been announced, what additions can we expect  in the PS4 version of the game?

Ha, it’s not quite announced! We expressed an interest in doing a PS4 version – and yes, we would still like to – but this has yet to be decided. We have no doubt we could easily produce a PS4 version, but it has to make sense commercially. Given we have already successfully released on current gen and PC, is there a big enough market left to justify the time and cost of development? Will people want an ‘old’ game for their ‘new’ PS4, or will they want a new title? Is it good enough to just release a ‘next gen’ version, or do we need to make significant improvements and add more content? These are all things we have to think about, and we do not have the answer yet sorry!

e.

One element that you have made clear is that the game will not ship with online mode, with a focus on the single player mode. Why was that stand taken, given the scope for enhanced exposure on an online mode option?

Again, this was a really hard decision as we had spent some time  prototyping a fully featured multiplayer component. We made the decision to cut it after E3 2013, when Metro had such a great response from the press and fans for its single player campaign. The choice was – continue with multiplayer, or bring that group back into the main team and focus everything on single player.

Based on the community’s response, I think we made the right decision at the time – but it’s something we would like to return to. We hate to leave work unfinished.

f.

Tell us something on how you developed Artyom ‘s character. Compared to the person unsure of his path in 2033, he seems like a more confident explorer and fighter, is there a greater role in the pipeline for him?

To put it simply, in Metro 2033 Artyom was a ‘boy’ (okay, we was in his early  20’s but he was young, naïve and lived a sheltered life). Metro 2033 was the story of his journey to manhood, his loss of innocence. In Metro: Last Light, Artyom is a man -  jaded, burnt out, and guilty of genocide against the Dark Ones. His story is now one of salvation, redemption… Can he return to innocence? Through the player’s actions, and the way you play as Artyom, that question is answered.

g.

Despite being a linear shooter, Metro: Last Light is a systemic game. We specifically loved the concept of a button mapped specifically for the sole purpose of wiping your face….

And that is just one example! Yes, we wanted to give the player a huge range of controls and actions, far more than you might expect in a straight ‘shooter’ – although as we have said, we think Metro is more than just a shooter! The ability to wipe your mask is, I think, symbolic of our approach to design. It may seem like a small detail, but the cumulative effect of these details is what makes Metro such an immersive whole.

h.

The storyline, in contrast to the environs is very imaginative, with its blend of Nazis, the Communists and the Order. What were the factors you considered while putting together this story structure?

The storyline, we really have Dmitry Glukhovsky to thank for. The balance of power between the warring extremist factions is a theme that runs through both Metro 2033 and Metro: Last Light – it’s Dmitry’s pessimistic (but arguably realistic) metaphor for the nature of mankind, as well as a thinly veiled parable for the contemporary  social and political landscape. That injection of social realism into the storytelling gives us a more believable world than standard post-apocalyptic mythology.

i.

Dmitry Glukhovsky was working deeply with you on the game, what unique element do you think he brought to the game, in terms of characterization, gameplay aspects etc?

Dmitry contributed the key plotline and narrative themes, character studies and character development and the vast majority of actual dialogue, including all the side conversations that do so much to flesh out the game world. Actual scenario and gameplay design was handled by the studio. Having a master story teller like Dmitry involved really helped us elevate the narrative elements of the game, allowing 4A to focus on gameplay.

j.

What is the future of the console, how do you see social networks playing a part of the gaming sphere? Do you think it’s possible to have the same impact as purely console based games? Say, for the ipad or for Android?

All game-playing devices – PC, console, tablet and mobile – serve the needs of the gaming audience. Some game types are (currently) a naturally better fit for high power, high fidelity consoles and PC.

Sure, we will see social and connected features continue to transform console games as they have mobile, but as long as there is an audience for the kind of epic, long-form single player adventure that the console experience can deliver, you will continue to see games like Metro: Last Light being made!

k.

How far are we from putting a player bang in the middle of the action, as a virtual cast member

Doesn’t that already happen? Look at the MMO space, with games like EVE…

l.

Who is your gaming idol, someone whom you have idolized. Tell us of that one game that you would have loved to work on.

We are not so interested in what others are doing – we can only make the games we want to play!

m.

Android or Apple, who is the winner? Or even Windows?

Who the ‘winner’ is is not important here. What are the games? That’s all that matters.
articles.summary: It’s the game that’s got gaming wags shakin’ and droolin’. Metro: Last Light takes off from where Metro 2033 left off, going beak, make that bleaker, with Communists, stranded subways and the odd Nazi. T3 Middle East spoke to Huw Beynon, Global Brand Manager for Metro Last Light on the development roadmap and The Art Of Apocalyptic Survival Horror Color Texturing.
articles.author: Anil George

articles.title: Apple releases iOS 7 Beta version 2
articles.description:
Apple has released the second beta version of iOS 7, this time with support for the iPad.

When Apple released the iOS 7 beta earlier this month, it said the iPad version would be made available “soon”.

Some developers had already hacked it onto iPad devices, but support wasn’t official.

In addition to being available for the iPad, the second version of the beta brings back support for the voice memo app. Apple had left out support for it in the first version of the iOS 7 beta.

It also features many of the new Siri versions that were previewed at the Worldwide Developers Conference two weeks ago.

Registered developers can update their iOS 7 beta through their iPhones if they have the first version installed.

Those developers wanting to install the iOS 7 beta on their iPad will need to do so through iTunes.
articles.summary: Apple has released the second beta version of iOS 7, this time with support for the iPad.
articles.author: Ben Furfie

articles.title: Amazon's AutoRip gets you free MP3 versions of CDs/Vinyls you purchase
articles.description:
If you’re a customer of music on CDs or Vinyl, you can start downloading the MP3 version of a song for free with Amazon’s new autorip feature.

Anyone who decides to buy a song on a CD or Vinyl can also enjoy a free MP3 copy from Amazon’s new service.
Although the service has been available in the US since January, UK customers can now enjoy the offer - so Dubai residents getting their CD fix from Amazon UK can now try to get a piece of the action as well.
In 1999, the company started the sale of music and emerged with the idea of “autorip” to give customers who buy music on CDs or Vinyl the opportunity to have it on MP3.
Following years of decline, Amazon has stated that the new service has actually created a rise in CD and Vinyl sales.


Autorip is appealing to many customers, according to the head of music of Amazon UK, Paul Firth, who mentioned the benefits customers can take advantage of, including the option of listening to songs of their choice spreading from the physical to digital range.
articles.summary: If you’re a customer of music on CDs or Vinyl, you can start downloading the MP3 version of a song for free with Amazon’s new autorip feature.
articles.author: micha

articles.title: HTC One now in a gorgeous "glamour red" version
articles.description:
Thought the mighty HTC One couldn't get any better? Think again.

The Taiwanese company has just revealed a new "Glamour Red" version of the smartphone that will be launching in the UK next month.

But there's a catch, you see. The new model will be available exclusively to British Phones 4u customers when it arrives there from mid-July.

There's no telling if this is to be a permanent arrangement, or whether HTC will open it up to other customers worldwide and in the Middle East as time goes on - We know we'd want it here in the UAE rather sooner than later.

"The new HTC One in Glamour Red showcases the power of our flagship model in a colour that demands attention, whilst maintaining the high standards set for sophisticated design and build quality,” said Philip Blair, President of EMEA, HTC.

Of course inwardly it's still the same 4.7-inch, quad-core powered beauty that picked up five stars in our in-depth review.
articles.summary: Thought the mighty HTC One couldn't get any better? Think again.
articles.author: Simon Khoury

articles.title: Foxconn announces its own iPhone-compatible smartwatch
articles.description:
Foxconn, the company best known for manufacturing Apple products, has apparently decided to go it alone after announcing its very own smartwatch.

There's no official Apple involvement in this one - but the (currently nameless) watch will be able to connect to your iPhone and perform a variety of features.

Along with checking calls and status updates, Foxconn is reportedly including a variety of fitness functions such as a heart rate and respiration monitor. Fitting, as it does look a bit like the Nike+ Fuelband.

According to reports, the company is planning to release incremental updates to the smartwatch which could include a fingerprint scanner.

This is the second slice of smartwatch news we've had this week after Sony revealed its Sony Smartwatch 2 with a 1.6-inch, 220 x 176 screen on Tuesday.

And, as ever, the rumours of an Apple iWatch and a Google Android smartwatch continue to circulate.

There's no word on any kind of release date for Foxconn's creation, but we here at T3me.com hope it becomes a reality sooner rather than later.

What's your take on the growing smartwatch trend? Let us know your thoughts in the comments box below.

Source: Wantchinatimes
articles.summary: Foxconn, the company best known for manufacturing Apple products, has apparently decided to go it alone after announcing its very own smartwatch.
articles.author: Simon Khoury

articles.title: Practical Meter speedily charges your devices via USB
articles.description:
If you've ever had to charge any device from your laptop's USB outlet, you know it could take longer than med school. Well not anymore...

USB charging is a complicated thing. While most smart devices (say smartphones) can handle up to 5W of charging juice, complex "talk" between the device and the USB circuitry means your device gets much less than that most of the times.

This means extended charging times while you need that iPhone up and running asap.

Practical Meter is a rather handy KickStarter project that does some cool things to remedy that conundrum.

It sits between a USB power outlet (like your laptop's USB ports or solar charger) and the device you want to charge, displaying how efficient the charging process is via LED bars, and "tricking" the charging end into delivering the most power the device can safely handle.

You can see from the screenshot below that charging an iPhone from a laptop's USB port normally takes 4 hours, but by using Practical Meter you can halve your waiting time into 1.5 hours.

Not only that, Practical Meter also includes a special cable with a USB tip from one end, and a microUSB, a miniUSB and an Apple 30-pin dock to charge all of your devices via one solution (and slash the amount of cables you lug around in your backpack).

You can pre-order Practical Meter via its KickStarter project page.
articles.summary: If you've ever had to charge any device from your laptop's USB outlet, you know it could take longer than med school. Well not anymore...
articles.author: Simon Khoury

articles.title: How to repair your bricked PS3 after 4.45 update via firmware fix
articles.description:
Sony has released an update to repair the faulty firmware upgrade that left some PS3s ‘bricked’.


The company pulled PS3 update 4.45 when it became apparent it was causing some consoles to stop loading.

Last week, the company released update 4.46. The update is designed to fix the problems that 4.45 was intended to fix, albeit without the problem that caused some PS3s to become inoperable.

For those PS3 owners affected by last week’s patch, Sony has published a step-by-step guide to install the new firmware.

It involves accessing the PS3’s hidden safe model. You will also require a USB stick.

Step 1: Manually Download System Software

  • You will need a USB Mass Storage device such as a USB flash drive with at least 168 MB of free space. If your PS3 is either CECHA00/CECHB00 series model, you can also use Memory Stick™, SD Memory Card, and CompactFlash®.
  • Create a folder named "PS3" on the storage media or USB device.
  • Within the PS3 folder, create a folder named "UPDATE".
  • Using your computer, click the following hyperlink to begin downloading system software 4.46
  • Download the update data from the webpage and save it in the "UPDATE" folder.
  • Location: Save in the "PS3" folder > "UPDATE" folder
  • File name: Save as file name "PS3UPDAT.PUP"
  • Note: If the data is not saved in the correct way, the PS3 will not recognize the update data. The folder name must be in all uppercase letters.

Step 2: Activate Safe Mode

  • With the PS3 off (power light should be red), touch and hold the Power button, you will hear the 1st beep indicating that the PS3 is powering on.
  • Continue to hold the power button, and after approximately 5 seconds you will hear a 2nd beep.
  • Continue to hold the power button and after 5 more seconds you'll hear a 3rd beep, and system will power off (Power light goes red).
  • Release power button.
  • Touch and hold the Power button, you will hear the 1st beep, again for PS3 power on.
  • Continue to hold and after approximately 5 seconds you will hear the 2nd beep for video reset.
  • Continue to hold and after 5 seconds you will hear a quick double beep. At that point release power button.
  • If you succeeded in activating Safe Mode, you will see a message on screen saying, "Connect the controller using a USB cable and then press the PS button".
  • Connect a controller to the PS3 with a USB cable.
  • If you were not able to get into Safe Mode, your system may need service. Please contact us for further assistance.

Step 3: Manually Update PS3 Software

  • Connect the storage media to PS3 system.
  • Select [6 - System Update] and Press X.
  • Please note: Data and settings may be deleted if you choose any of the first (5) options. Please make sure to only choose option [6 - System Update].
  • Press Start and Select at the same time.
  • The PS3 system will restart and recognizes the update file in the storage media.
  • Press right on the d-pad to scroll through the update description and user agreement.
  • Press X to confirm the update.
  • The system will now install the new system software and restart automatically upon completion.
articles.summary: Sony has released an update to repair the faulty firmware upgrade that left some PS3s ‘bricked’.
articles.author: Simon Khoury
